qas.question: An imbalance in the intake of nutrients by any organism can be referred by which term?
In what kind of country is malnutrition often found as excessive consumption or as a nutritional imbalance?
Aside from inadequate knowledge, what else is characteristic of malnutrition found in developing countries?

answers.text: poor access to a range of nutritious foods

qas.question: What is the abbreviation ICRISAT short for?

answers.text: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics

qas.question: What is the name of the traditional Mali recipe that equinut is a twist on?

context: <a0_0>Malnutrition<a0_0/> refers to insufficient, excessive, or imbalanced consumption of nutrients by an organism. In <a1_0>developed<a1_0/> countries, the diseases of malnutrition are most often associated with nutritional imbalances or excessive consumption. In developing countries, malnutrition is more likely to be caused by <a2_0>poor access to a range of nutritious foods<a2_0/> or inadequate knowledge. In Mali the <a3_0>International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics<a3_0/> (ICRISAT) and the Aga Khan Foundation, trained women's groups to make equinut, a healthy and nutritional version of the traditional recipe <a4_0>di-dèguè<a4_0/> (comprising peanut paste, honey and millet or rice flour). The aim was to boost nutrition and livelihoods by producing a product that women could make and sell, and which would be accepted by the local community because of its local heritage.
